result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Vernon Krumrey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DE called to ck the status of his Pymt Plan & inquire when his 1st pymt is due.  DE was advised that his 1st pymt was due 2-10-19 & his debt has since been turned over to Coll (SDC).  DE was advised that he would have been sent notice of this, but his mail has been ret'd.  I inquired if the DE has moved since his last address change in Dec 2018 & he stated he has not, but likely hasn't checked or opened his mail.  DE was given the phone # for SDC & advised to call them to make pymts.  Includes 10CF212, 13CF245, 14CF229, 16CF46.  jaf
State Debt Collection - Notice of Intent returned from post office, return to sender.  Attempted not known/unable to forward. gme
DE appeared.  DE to pay $25/mo comm 2-10-19.  DE signed PPA.  Includes 10CF212, 13CF245, 16CF46.  jaf

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Edward Minser, DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton, DF:  Andrew Vernon Krumrey appeared. Includes 14CF229 - MH and 16CF46 - Pleah. Cases called at 8:45 pm. Court notes that there is a pending motion to revoke DP agreement in case 14CF229. Parties set to plea to 16CF46. ADA Minser moves to amend 16CF46 to MISDEMEANOR 946.425(1m)(a) - Failure to report. Court amends and reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads guilty to the AMENDED Ct 1 in 16CF46. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly/intelligently waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of the Amended Ct 1 in 16CF46. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant files letter for Court to review. Court summarizes letter and orders: 
- 30 IMPOSED / STAYED days in SCC Jail with the condition of successful completion of agreement in 14CF229. 
- $243.00 in Court costs
- $200.00 DNA surcharge and sample
Court orders defendant on a payment plan of $25.00 per month to begin January 1, 2017.

RE: 14CF229 - ADA Minser withdraws motion to revoke agreement. Agreement to continue in current status until 7/7/17. Diversion Coordinator to provide quarterly updates.
Plea hearing on July 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Plea hearing scheduled for July 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Joseph Robert Caton DF: Andrew Vernon Krumrey appeared. Case called at 1:03. Includes 14CF229, 16CF46. On 16CF46 Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. NG. Waives speedy trial. On 14CF229 court reviews motion to revoke. Atty. Caton responds. ADA Hartung requests to reserve on the motion today. DE is going to serve jail all at one time instead of intermittently. Court amends JOC in 14CF229 to 3 months conditional jail time with huber for employment or seek work to be served in a block time. DE is presently serving. Address confirmed. Court accepts admin. transfer of the 16CF46. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on May 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
